content.description: Stand start on a crack. Move left along the crack and then up a low angle, right-facing dihedral.
content.protection: Pads. The landing is nice and flat, but it's pretty high.
content.location:
It is right behind you if you're on

Lady Luck

.

content.description: Start on the jug. Move a right hand to the gaston ledge, left hand to the deep mono. Throw right to the slopey arete and top on with okay holds.
content.location: This is on the Snowstorm Boulders.

content.description: Start on the obvious jug and work up the face.
content.location: This is on the Snowstorm Boulder in the area named The Gathering.

content.description: Start with your right hand on a bad pinch and your left on a good crimp. Work up the arete and top out.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location:
This is on the Snowstorm Boulder.

Per

Andy Librande

: this is located right of what is labeled as

Lady Luck

on the obvious arete.

content.description: Start on the rail, work up the arete/face. The topout is the crux.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: This is on the Snowstorm Boulder.

content.description:
This route or similar might have been done before, but I'm adding it to the list. It starts low with your right hand in a 2 to 3 finger pocket and your left hand on a nice side jug. Next, move your left hand to another nice side jug. Move out right hand to crimp. Next, get a left hand crimp near the lip of the boulder. Begin your ascent over the lip using crimps or work your way right to top out the same as

Lady Luck

. The crux is similar to the others: getting over the lip and up on top of the boulder.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.
content.location:
This is on the Snowstorm Boulder, left of

Lady Luck

.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
